properties.areaDesc: Marathon; Langlade; Lincoln; Forest; Wood; Oneida; Vilas
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
The arctic cold front has dropped south of the area. The light
snow will taper off to flurries this evening, except across Vilas
County where scattered snow showers will linger into Thursday
morning. Any additional snow accumulation should be less than an
inch, except for locally higher amounts across the snowbelt region
of northwest Vilas County.

The combination of the snow, along with melting snow from this
afternoon and falling air temperatures well below freezing could
lead to a flash freeze this evening. Gusty northerly winds may
also create some areas of blowing and drifting snow.

Overnight, temperatures are expected to fall into the single
digits below zero. The combination of the cold temperatures and
gusty northerly winds will produce wind chill readings in the
15 below to 25 below zero range late tonight into Thursday
morning. Wind chill readings this low can produce frost bite
within 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving this evening as
roads will be slippery due to ice or snow. If venturing outdoors,
wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to protect
yourself from the bitter cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY BITTER COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
